content.text:
That makes sense. Do you guys use it for Git branches and such as well? I've noticed that sometimes I'll use "master" rather than "`master`" out of laziness, but then I got curious what my actual policy on backticks was.

I know that having a "policy" is a bit silly, but somehow the [obsessive] consistency feels 
really nice. Wish I could put it into words.

I had similar "policy" questions regarding what to call `/F?\/?L?OSS/`, the correct name for `/(GNU[+\/])?Linux/`, etc., but it went a bit off the rails: %FOvnH4pUvv9uXiUnlz6gqYp2wxfDwexZVKiloG4b3U0=.sha256
